Wales largest youth organisation has announced it will be celebrating its centenary in the new year bylt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentWALES largest youth organisation has announced it will be celebrating its centenary in the new year by throwing a huge birthday party in schools across the country and attempting to complete two world records.Urdd Gobaith Cymru was established as a youth movement in  and has since had over four million members.It plans to mark the milestone by holding the biggest birthday bash in its history while attempting two Guinness World Records by getting the largest number of people to upload a video of themselves singing a song to Facebook and Twitter in one hour.The attempts, to get the most people to post their version of Hei Mistar Urdd - the organisations anthem, will take place on January  and be broadcast live on BBC Radio Wales.The current Facebook record is  videos, and on Twitter it is .On the same day, Welsh landmarks including the Senedd, St Fagans Folk Museum, Big Pit and the National Waterfront Museum, along with businesses, schools and other organisations, will wave the Urdd flag.Sian Lewis, the Urdds chief executive, said: "There is no doubt that the period since March  has been the most challenging in our history. As a result of the Covid- pandemic, we had to close our camps and our regular community, sporting and cultural activities had to stop."However, we are rebuilding, and the year of our centenary will be one to remember, with the plans of every department reflecting our spirit and ambition."I call on all the schools, clubs, volunteers, businesses and organisations in Wales, and new and former members, to join the biggest party in our history.MORE NEWS:"This is an opportunity for you to celebrate and for us to thank everyone who has played a small or signicant part in making the Urdd an important movement for Wales and the people of Wales.".removeFirst launched by Sir Ifan ab Owen Edwards almost  years ago in Flintshire, north-east Wales, The Urdd employs over  people across the country and contributes pound million to the Welsh economy.Tens of thousands of school children visit their summer camps every year, and in  they will open the first environmental camp of its kind in Wales at Pentre Ifan in Pembrokeshire, as well as the opening of the Heart of the Centre in Llangrannog, and a new water centre in Glan-llyn.They are also the leading provider of apprenticeships through the medium of Welsh in the third sector in Wales.Dozens more events are planned to take place throughout the anniversary including a concert to be held by the BBC National Orchestra of Wales.The National Library of Wales, official home of the Urdds archive, has planned a number of commemorative exhibitions and workshops.The chief executive and librarian at the National Library, Pedr ap Llwyd, said: "The Urdd continues to be an indispensable national movement that continues to enrich the lives of children and young people while promoting the Welsh language at the same time."The extent of the organisations contribution to our national le is immeasurable and were proud to say that much of the organisations work is recorded here in the librarys collections, in archival collections, books, sound and moving images."Click through the gallery above to see some pictures from the past  years of Urdd Gobaith CymruGet involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos title: wales introduces pcr tests international travellers
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThis announcement was made after Prime Minister Boris Johnson implemented it for England in a press conference yesterday.In a tweet last night Mark Drakeford, First Minister of Wales said: ldquoWales is bringing in the same international travel measures as the rest of the UK. The Cabinet will continue to meet this evening and tomorrow to monitor the developing situation and decidefurther action is required to protect peoplersquos health.Why is this happening The governments in the UK have all taken this move to prevent the spread of the new Omicron iant of Covid- which was detected in the UK this weekend. Two cases of the Omicron iant were located in Nottingham and Brentford in Essex. Scientists are concerned that the vaccines may not be protective against this iant.What does this mean for me If youfrom any country outside of the UK, you will have to take a PCR test and isolate until the test result is negative.However,you come from a red list country - Angola, Malawi, Mozambique, Zambia, Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Namibia, South Africa and Zimbabwe, you will not be able to enter Wales. You will have tothrough England or Scotland and quarantine for  days and take PCR tests on day two and eight.MORE NEWS:New Covid iant found in UKWales largest youth organisation to mark centenary with world record attemptsWhat  is happening In a press conference last night, Boris Johnson also issued theof mandatory face coverings in shops and on public transport. This already applies in Wales as well as in Scotland and Northern Ireland. It does not apply to pubs and restaurants.Mr Johnson said border measures can ldquoonly ever minimise and delay the arrival of a new iant rather than stop it all together, so all contacts with a suspected case of the new iant will have to isolate for  days, regardless of their vaccination status..removeChief scientic adviser Sir Patrick Vallance said the country needs to ldquoface up to the possibility the iant will be a ldquomajor issueit turns out to be highly-transmissible and evades immunity.He said that the existing booster programme is the current priority, but that vaccine manufacturers believe they can tweak their existing jabs to better counter Omicron ldquoin about  days.Englandrsquos chief medical officer, Professor Chris Whitty, told the press conference on Saturday that the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisationwill be tasked with looking at whether boosters can be extended from the over-s to the over-s.They will also consider whether second doses should be offered to  to -year-olds, and whether the waiting time before a booster jab could be reduced. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityHolm oak tree at Kymin Park in Penarth" This is how you can share your ideas for the future of Kymin ParkMap of the Kymin" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentALL ARE welcome to a community event to help shape the future of Kymin Park.An activity morgan run by communitygroups Gwyrddio Penarth Greening , Penarth Growing Community andFriends of the Kymin will be on Saturday December  from am.Members of the public are invited to the family friendly event to help prepare a wildflower meadow area, share their thoughts to help shape the project, and explore the woodland areas.In  Penarth Town Council, the leaseholder, announced its intention tothe park and house to the Vale of Glamorgan Council and there was much public concern when the house and an area of the park were subsequently offered as a commercial opportunity on a -year lease.The Friends of the Kymin was formed to celebrate and protect the natural heritage of the area and promote public access to the house and gardens.Vale of Glamorgan Council are no longer seeking to offer a lease but instead wish to see a sustainable community use for the park and house, with park officers working with the community groups to enable this.GPG recently obtaining a Keep Wales Tidy Local Places for Nature growing pack which will provide some community growing equipment.Sally Hughes from GPGs Penarth Growing Community project said: "The Kymin is a place which many local people hold dear.ldquoWe are delighted to be working with the Friends of the Kymin and the Vale of Glamorgan Council to protect and enhance the park, while maintaining its quiet woodland feel.ldquoThis is our first opportunity to involve the community, and we are keen to draw on the vast knowledge of local people as we begin to explore the grounds, the plants and wildle that flourish there.GPG and the Friends of the Kymin already successfully planted a community orchard at the Kymin earlier this year.A community map of the Kymin is being developed and the public are invited to come along and talk about features and areas of the park that are special for them..removeThe morning will conclude with a short walk in the coastal woodlands.The timetable on December  is:am - raking the top meadow area am - short exploration of the coastal woodlands, including a walk for children and young people.am - a chance to hear about the GPG community growing project and talk about what is important for you at the KyminLet them know you are coming atpenarthgrowingcommunity community-morning-at-the-kymin Find out more at:penarthgpg.orgfriendsofthekymin.mystrikingly Maintenance work will close the road between pm on Monday and am on Tuesday.M westbound, junction -: The entry slip road of the M at junction  for Miskin will be closed overnight this week. Electrical work is being carried out on the section of road, forcing the westbound entry slip road to shut. Overnight closures will begin on Monday and run until Friday, with the road closed between pm and .am.M westbound, junction -: Surveys will close the exit slip road at junction  for Earlswood on the westbound M this week. The closure will take place on Tuesday night. With the exit shut between pm and am.M eastbound, junction -: The eastbound carriageway of the M will close on Tuesday night, between junction  for Capel Llanilltern and junction  for Coryton. Maintenance work will force the section of road to shut between pm on Tuesday and am on Wednesday.M westbound, junction -: The westbound carriageway between junction  for Coryton and junction  for Capel Llanilltern will also have to close overnight this week. title: monmouth schools named among best wales sunday times
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe Sunday Times has this morning published its Parent Power, The Sunday Times Schools Guide The th edition of the guide reveals highest-achieving schools in Wales and the UK, ranked by their examination results from -.Gwent schools named among best in WalesTwo Monmouth schools feature on the list of the top  independent secondary schools in the country.Both Monmouth School for Girlsand Monmouth School for Boysmake it onto the top ten in Wales.Almost three quarters of A-Level results at the girlsrsquo school ed results of A*-B, while . per cent of A-level results at the boysrsquo school hit that mark.Across the UK, Monmouth School for Girls ranked th for independent secondary schools, and Monmouth School for Boys ranked .Alastair McCall, editor of Parent Power, said: ldquoThe need for clarity about school examination performance has never been greater after two years of teacher assessed grades, during which for completely understandable reasons, the numbers of top grades increased dramatically.ldquoWe felt it was important to go back to the last sets of moderated public examination outcomes from ,  and  to get the most accurate and current view of school academic achievement. By taking a three-year average, we mitigated against relatively poor performance in a one-off year.ldquoAt a time when some schools are making hard to substantiate claims of academic prowess based on outcomes from  and , we believe these rankings ndash and all the additional information on offer in Parent Power ndash provide parents with a more reliable guide to academic achievement in schools today.Top  state secondary schools in WalesThese are the top  state secondary schools in Wales according to the Parent Power, The Sunday Times Schools Guide , and their rank among UK schools..removeTop  independent secondary schools in WalesAnd these are the top  independent secondary schools in Wales according to the Parent Power, The Sunday Times Schools Guide , and their rank among UK schools.The rankings in the secondary school league tables are determined by the average percentage of examination entries in the three years, -, gaining A* to B grades at A-leveland the average percentage of entries ing - or A* and A grades at GCSE.Only schools that published their results in those years or disclosed them to The Sunday Times have been included in this edition of The Sunday Times Schools Guide, which includes around , schools. Examination outcomes from  and  have not been used in determining this yearrsquos Parent Power rankings.The full Parent Power, The Sunday Times Schools Guide  is available online today, and as a supplement with The Sunday Times on Sunday, December . article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: first case omicron coronavirus variant confirmed wales
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityA case of the Omicron iant of concern has been confirmed in the Cardf and Vale University Health Board area.It is being linked to international travel.The Welsh Government have said that they are prepared to "respond rapidly" to emerging iants of concern and that "intensive investigations and robust public health actionare being taken" to slow any spread.:"The health impact of the Omicron iant is still being assessed," said a spokesperson."Currently there is no substantial evidence to suggest the Omicron iant will lead to a more severe form of illness but the data is being kept under constant review."As we better understand this iant we will be able to determine the next steps."They stressed that, in the meantime, "sticking to the rules, following the steps which keep us safe and taking up the offer of a vaccine" continue to be the best way to protect ourselves and the NHS. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: energy secretary review power firms operations following storm arwen outages
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityIt comes as the Energy Networks Associationsaid that , homes were still waiting to be reconnected as of pm on Sunday. This was down from , homes on Sunday morning.The majority of the impacted homes were in the north-east of England, the ENA added.Mr Kwarteng visited the North East on Sunday to survey the damage done by the storm.During a visit to a Northern Powergrid call centre in Penshaw near Sunderland, Mr Kwarteng told the PA news agency: ldquoI think we can make the system a lot more resilient.ldquoI had an experience on August   when a million people in the South East were commuting and they had a power outage.ldquoImmediately after that we had a review and we looked at the system and we held the transport and train companiesrsquo feet to the fire and we have got a more resilient system.ldquoThatrsquos exactly what I want to happen this time. vw,vw,px, px"Thousands of people have been without power for more than a week following Storm Arwen ldquoWe will have a review, we will seethe distributor companies have enough infrastructure, we may even have enforcement actionnecessary.Speaking at the call centre, Mr Kwarteng said: ldquoI donrsquot accept that .ldquoThe physical infrastructure, lay out and landscape is very dferent.ldquoOne of the particular reasons why we havenrsquot got people back on the power supply is the weather conditions and they are very challengingpeople in sparsely populated, very rural areas, and that represents a challenge.It comes as Storm Barra is set to hit the UK on Tuesday, bringing strong winds and rain.As a result, yellow wind weather warnings are in place across England, Wales and Northern Ireland, with yellow snow warnings in place in southern and western Scotland..removeA spokesperson for Energy Networks Association said that operators were ldquoworking together to prepare for the storm. vw,vw,px, px"Boris Johnson said he had held calls with those leading the response to Storm Arwen On Saturday, gusts of between  to  miles per hour battered the country overnight, with temperatures plummeting to below zero in parts of Scotland.As well as weather warnings, the Met Office predicts further wet and windy weather heading into next week, with poor weather conditions continuing in areas already impacted by Storm Arwen.Met Office meteorologist Rachel Ayers said: ldquoIt will be a relatively nice day today, but overnight tonight it will be windy.ldquoTemperatures, with the wind and cloud cover, should stay up tonight.ldquoThat should help things a little bit, but we are expecting some more changeable and unsettled weather.ldquoThis unsettled weather isnrsquot going to help areas that have been impacted by Storm Arwen too much.Engineers are working hard to rebuild damaged parts of the network to customers reconnected. Check out our update for the latest picture ##https:t.co PvkePgyWK#: @UKPowerNetworks pic dkoFlhLhumdash Energy Networks AssociationDecember , The Ministry of Defence told PA that  personnel from the British Army and Royal Marines were still providing support to civil authorities and conducting door-to-door checks on vulnerable people on Sunday morning.On Saturday, Boris Johnson said he had held calls with those leading the response to Storm Arwen and the Government was ready to further support the recovery work ldquoin any way we can.The long delays have prompted energy regulator Ofgem to warn it will take enforcement action against network companies who failed to restore power to customers quickly enough.It has also agreed with firms to lt the pound cap on compensation which could be offered to those stuck without power." data-title"Members of the armed forces check on overhead power cables " data--holder"PA Wire" data--notice"PA Wire PA Images" data-credit"Danny Lawson" title: chris cuomo accused harassment days cnn firing
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityLawyer Debra Katz said on Sunday that her client was the victim of ldquoserious sexual misconduct by Mr Cuomo and that she had contacted CNN about the womanrsquos allegations on Wednesday.CNN suspended Mr Cuomo earlier this week after details emerged about how he assisted his brother, former New York governor Andrew Cuomo, as the politician faced sexual harassment allegations.Network officials said ldquoadditional information has come to light when it announced Chris Cuomorsquos firing, but did not elaborate.Ms Katz said the accuser decided to come forward after the New York attorney generalrsquos office released evidence showing Chris Cuomo had taken a much more active role than previously thought in strategising and helping to craft a response to the allegations his brother was facing.When the initial allegations surfaced against Andrew Cuomo, Chris Cuomo had told viewers he had ldquoalways cared very deeply about these issues, Ms Katz said.ldquoHearing the hypocrisy of Chris Cuomorsquos on-air words and disgusted by his efforts to try to discredit these women, my client retained counsel to report his serious sexual misconduct against her to CNN, Ms Katz said in the statement.pic YArsJnUjqfmdash Christopher C. CuomoDecember , CNN was reviewing Chris Cuomorsquos conduct following the new information, and a law firm hired to help had recommended the network terminate his employment.ldquoIt goes without saying that these decisions are not easy, and there are a lot of complex factors involved, CNN chief Jeff Zucker wrote in an email to staff on Saturday.Chris Cuomo issued a statement on Twitter calling the decision disappointing.ldquoThis is not how I want my time at CNN to end but I have already told you why and how I helped my brother. So let me now say as disappointing as this is, I could not be more proud of the team at Cuomo Prime Time and the work we did, he said..removeThe new misconduct allegation comes after a veteran TV executive, Shelley Ross, wrote a column for The New York Times in September saying Chris Cuomo had groped her at a party  years ago, when they both worked for ABC News.Chris Cuomo told the newspaper that ldquoI apologised to her then, and I meant it..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Chris Cuomo accused of harassment days before CNN firing article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: fauci says early reports encouraging omicron variant
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityPresident Joe Bidenrsquos chief medical adviser Dr Anthony Fauci told CNNrsquos State Of The Union that scientists need more information before drawing conclusionrsquos about omicronrsquos severity.Reports from South Africa, where it emerged and is becoming the dominant strain, suggest that hospital admission rates have not increased alarmingly.ldquoThus far, it does not look like therersquos a great degree of severity to it, Dr Fauci said.ldquoBut we have really got to be careful before we make any determinations that it is less severe or it really doesnrsquot cause any severe illness, comparable to delta.Respect is owed to the science and technology expertise in African countries as well as their transparency and sharing, including data related to the Omicron iant of concern. This is helping to ensure a safer world for all people everywhere. #COVIDmdash Tedros Adhanom GhebreyesusDecember , Dr Fauci said the Biden administration is considering lting travel restrictions against non-citizens entering the United States from several African countries.They were imposed as the Omicron iant exploded in the region, but UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has blasted such measures as ldquotravel apartheid.ldquoHopefully wersquoll be able to lt that ban in a quite reasonable period of time, Dr Fauci said. ldquoWe all feel very badly about the hardship that has been put on not only on South Africa but the other African countries.Omicron had been detected in about a third of US states by Sunday, including in the Northeast, the South, the Great Plains and the West Coast. Wisconsin and Missouri were among the latest states to confirm cases.But Delta remains the dominant iant, making up more than % of cases and driving a surge of hospital admissions in the north..removeNational Guard teams have been sent to help overwhelmed hospitals in western New York, and Massachusetts Gov Charlie Baker issued an emergency order requiring any hospitals facing limited patient capacity to reduce scheduled procedures that are not urgent.US officials continued urging people to get vaccinated and to receive booster shots, as well as take precautions such as wearing masks when among strangers indoors, saying anything that helps protect against delta will also help protect against other iants.EvenOmicron proves less dangerous than Delta, it remains problematic, World Health Organisation epidemiologist Dr Maria Van Kerkhove said.ldquoEvenwe have a large number of cases that are mild, some of those iniduals will need hospitalisations, she said.ldquoThey will need to go into ICU and some people will die. We donrsquot want to see that happen on top of an already dficult situation with Delta circulating globally.Two years into the outbreak, Covid- has killed more than , Americans, and deaths are running at about  per day.More than , new hospital admissions are being reported daily, according to tracking data from the US Centres for Disease Control and Prevention.Covid- cases and deaths in the US have dropped by about half since the Delta peak in August and September, but at more than , new infections per day, the numbers are still high, especially heading into the holidays, when people travel and gather with family..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Fauci says early reports  uencouraging u about Omicron iant article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe unlikely partnership has released the "festive mash-up that you didnrsquot know you neededin the form of their Chocolate Orange Mayo.The new product has blended thefamily favourites together and is a mix ofmayonnaise and chocolate orange segments, creme patisserie and an extra dose of orange oil.The brands have suggested that the spread will work "perfectly dolloped onto your festive desserts or spread onto brioche, crumpets, pancakes, or croissants this festive season".How to getthe HeinzChocolate Orange MayonnaiseYou cant buy the spread but those brave enough to sample the new product can enter an exclusive competition.Heinz and Terrys are giving you the chance to win one of  jars until December .You can enter the competition via the Heinz to Home website.Heinz Chocolate Orange Mayo. Credit: Heinz PAHeinz sauces senior brand manager Maria Jantchi said: ldquoHere at Heinz, we are always innovating, and love creating fun new limited-edition products that we know our fans will love."So, this year we set out to create the most Christmassy mayo that we could think of.ldquoAnd who better to partner with for that than the iconic Terryrsquos Chocolate Orange, everyonersquos favourite Christmas treat ldquoAnd so, after months of development, we are absolutely delighted to be launching the worldrsquos first-ever Chocolate Orange Mayo, just in time for Christmas.Terryrsquos Chocolate Orange marketing controller Laure Gentil said: ldquoSince Terryrsquos Chocolate Orange launched in  we have never stopped innovating, growing, and launching new formats and flavours to delight our loyal fans, and we are proud to be continuing this Christmas with our mayo mash-up, which works perfectly as a delicious spread.Last month, Heinz launched its ldquoChristmas in a can which is a Christmas Dinner soup complete with turkey, Brussels sprouts and pigs in blankets..removeHeinz [Seriously] Good Terryrsquos Chocolate Orange Mayo is here! Would you try it  ##We have  #ChocOrangeMayos up for grabs, enter here - https:t.co ehufFMlQEOpen to UK residents +. One entry per person. Ends pm ... See link for full TCs. pic wDsByrXHxmdash HeinzDecember , The new product has not exactly been well received by fans.One user on Twitter quote tweeted the announcement, writing: "Is it really April st  Not December st  Not sure how we feel about this one... what about you Paired with a vomit green face emoji,another tweeted: "What in gods green earth is this ! No. Just no!!"While another user asked: "I like Mayonnaise  I like Chocolate Orange but not together."Seriously, who on earth thought that this would be a good idea ". article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: new psm fund for greenway and active travel projects in ni welcomed
story: New rector at Kilmore is a familiar face   Canon Bertram Livingston - a man of deep faith who rose to the challenge of setting up a new church in s NI and had the respect of all faithsNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsNew £m fund for greenway and active travel projects in NI welcomedA new £m fund for greenway and active travel projects is to be administered by councils across NI.By Carmel RobinsonFriday, rd December , : pm  "       "  SDLP Upper Bann MLA Dolores Kelly has welcomed extra funding which was announced by SDLP Infrastructure Minister Nichola Mallon on Tuesday last week. Armagh City, Banbridge and Craigavon will benefit from greenway works in Dromore and secure cycle parking, bike repair stands and cycle counters.Mrs Kelly said: “The announcement of an additional £m funding from SDLP Infrastructure Minister Nichola Mallon will benefit projects and people locally and across the North. Since becoming a minister, Nichola Mallon has made greenway and active travel projects a key priority for her and it’s great to see this delivery building on the success of other projects in this area. “In Upper Bann, cycle parking facilities and its usage have been generally very low but a large proportion are located on private land for customer use. However, the potential cycle parking solutions considered by Council offers a higher level of cycle parking given the visibility and security of the locations, followed by off street car parks, parks and then within the existing footways of the town centre. “The fact that SDLP Minister Mallon received more applications for funding than anticipated demonstrates the popularity of these projects and schemes across the North.“ The coronavirus pandemic highlighted the importance of having local greenways and outdoor spaces that people can enjoy and this funding commitment from the Minister will improve the lives of communities across the North. “The SDLP is determined to deliver the projects that matter to local people and I’m delighted to see SDLP Minister Mallon continue in this vein.” New hospital for Craigavon in limbo as Departments of Health and Finance wrangle over costEditor’s Message:Thank you for reading this article. We’re more reliant on your support than ever as the sht in consumer habits brought about by Coronavirus impacts our advertisers.Please consider purchasing a copy of the paper. title: glamorous movie premiere for a christmas dream filmed entirely in the craigavon area
story: Man in hospital after two vehicle crash in Lurgan, Co Armagh   New jobs created as paint business expandsNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPeopleGlamorous movie premiere for ‘A Christmas Dream’ filmed entirely in the Craigavon areaAn exciting new Christmas movie, starring men, women and children from the Portadown, Craigavon and Lurgan areas, is to premiere next month.By Carmel RobinsonWednesday, th November , : am  "       "  Tickets are now on sale for the glamorous premiere of A Christmas Dream, the brainchild of veteran producer and director Kieran Corr.The Craigavon man is no stranger to treading the boards as Chairman of Moyraverty Arts and Drama Society but this is his first official juncture into the movie industry.Kieran, who can now add movie producer to his list of talents, revealed that they had just finished filming the final scene of A Christmas Dream.Some of the cast of the new movie A Christmas Dream produced by Moyraverty Arts and Drama Society in Craigavon.“The premiere is going to happen a week before Christmas and I would like to thank my co-writer Ellen Creaney for her input and advice. “In total we had over  people take part in the film. One of the youngest was Anna McGuinness who is only five and it included people of all ages. “I would like to thank our camera man Paul Heaney, choreographer Claire Louise Mooney and Jonny McGuinness who has written two original songs for the film and also composed the music. Many thanks to the entire cast and the MADS Committee for making this production possible. We now are all looking forward to seeing the film. “We filmed scenes at Cosy Coffee Lurgan, Cafe Vibe Lurgan, Shear Experience Lurgan, Perfect Day Lurgan, Lismore Comprehensive, Craigavon Civic Centre, Armagh Theatre, Kinnego Marina, Aine Mc Beauty Salon Carrigart, The Corner House Derrymacash, Miss Mac Dance Studio Lurgan and at the leading lady, Sophie Doyle’s own house. Sophie, Anna and Caitriona who are in the movie A Christmas Dream run by Moyraverty Arts and Drama Society in Craigavon.“The lead roles in the film was performed by Sophie Doyle from Aghagallon, a pupil of Our Lady’s Newry and Jake Watters from Lurgan who attends Lisburn Tech. Krise Hamill from Craigavon, Aimee Prigent from Lurgan, Maeve Scullion from Lurgan, Alana Cahoon from Portadown and Odhran Livingstone from Silverwood all perform key roles. “Sophie’s mother in the film was performed by Laura Haddock, a teacher at The Presentation PS, Portadown. Her dad was performed by Aaron Murphy, a teacher at St Brendan’s PS and her brother was performed by Fionn O Hagan who is a pupil at Lismore Comprehensive. We were delighted to involve all of MADS juniors in the film and this is a great opportunity for them all to perform in a Christmas film.” “The Premiere will take place on Saturday th December at Craigavon Civic and Conference Centre. Doors open at pm and the film will be shown at .pm. Due to restrictions a limited number of tickets. at £, are now available. This includes a wine reception for adults and juice and popcorn for children. It promises to be a perfect Christmas night out for the entire family. Kieran said: “This film is made in memory of my late brother The Very Rev Fr Tony Corr PP who died suddenly on June  this year aged .Jake Watters and Sophie Doyle who star in the movie A Christmas Dream produced by Moyraverty Arts and Drama Society.“He was my inspiration and support with this production. He helped me in what was a very dficult period in my le, fighting cancer, learning how to walk again and appreciating le. He read the first draft of the film and helped me make changes etc. “I owe him so much and miss him so much. The loss of Tony affected so many people. To everyone who knew Tony. you will all have your very own personal memories of Tony which will stay in our hearts forever. This film will certainly put a smile on my face every Christmas for as long as I live.” Tickets at www.ticketsource moyraverty-arts-and-drama-societyBus and police car collide at Christmas lights switch-on in PortadownEditor’s Message:Thank you for reading this article. title: junior reporter needed to interview the fureys
story: Billy Wright and Robin Jackson were ‘state agents’ claims BBC documentary   Air Ambulance at ‘incident’ close to building siteNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPeopleJunior reporter needed to interview The FureysWe’re on the lookout for a junior reporter interested in the unique assignment of interviewing members of top Irish folk band, The Fureys.By Valerie MartinMonday, th November , : am  "       "  The Fureys, will be performing at the Waterfront Hall in Belfast on Saturday, January  and in advance of this showpiece event, we are giving one young person a unique opportunity to interview Eddie and George Furey from the band.The interview will take place at the Waterfront Hall in Belfast on Monday, December . Our junior reporter will have their showbiz interview scoop published across all of our Northern Ireland weekly newspapers.The junior reporter will also receive three tickets to see The Fureys in concert at the Waterfront Hall on Saturday January  and will write a review of the concert for our readers to enjoy.We are asking our readers to nominate a young person for this unique opportunity. Could your son, daughter, niece, nephew or grandchild fit the bill  Maybe you have a friend whose son or daughter would jump at this chance Our junior reporter will be aged approximately  - , with an interest in creative writing, English, media studies , and   or with an interest in journalism.They will prepare their own interview questions for The Fureys and write up theirinterview for their very own published feature exclusive.During their private audience with The Fureys, one of Ireland’s most famous music groups, our junior reporter will get the chance to uncover details of their amazing + year career, get an insight into their world tours, the amazing venues they have played in, what it was like to perform for the US President, how ex-PrimeMinister, Tony Blair, became a huge fan and much more. It will all be down to the questions our junior reporter asks!All you have to do to nominate a young person to be our junior reporter and interview The Fureys is tell us the name of the young person you wish to nominate and their relationship to you by the closing date of  noon on Monday, November . Email your entry by email to [email#protected] marking ‘The Fureys’ in the subject line. Please include your own name plus a contact phone number and email address where you can be reached.Please submit one question which the young person would like to ask The Fureys. All entries will be considered by a  of judges and the reader who has submitted the most interesting question will win the competition and be notied by us by Monday, November . A mutually suitable time for the interview at the Waterfront Hall on Monday, December  will be arranged. For tickets to see The Fureys at the Waterfront Hall in Belfast on Saturday, January , visit www.waterfront or phone   .Competition terms and conditions: Under s must be accompanied by a parent orto the Waterfront Hall on Monday, December  and any travel cost incurred will be at the accompanying adult’s expense.Normal JPIMedia competition rules apply, for more information go to: www.jpimedia competition.JPIMedia privacy Policy: https:www.jpimedia privacy-policyBelfastNorthern IrelandPresident  "       "  Most PopularCalling all parents: groups of children – oldest aged just  – abusing drink and drugs at weekend, says PSNI‘Lives at risk’ as house torched in rural Co ArmaghBilly Kennedy: My half century working in newspapersPortadown killer Garfield Beattie, jailed for sending threatening letter to daughter of his murder victim, challenges  month sentenceCanon Bertram Livingston - a man of deep faith who rose to the challenge of setting up a new church in s NI and had the respect of all faithsMost PopularAppeal after burglary in LurganCraigavon woman Teresa Traynor hits the road as a big hearted Woman with a VanNew £m fund for greenway and active travel projects in NI welcomedPortadown man Connor McNeill freed on bail after admitting shooting neighbour Stephen BarriskillRobinson to pay victims’ families                       This website and its associated newspaper are members of Independent Press Standards Organisation Follow us on    ExploreNewsSportWhats OnLestyleMore from Portadown TimesAnnouncementsJobsPublic NoticesMust ReadBuy a PhotoDirectoryUseful LinksContact UsAdvertise My BusinessAdvertise a JobPlace your AdSubscribeEventsArchiveReaders Charter " fill"#ea"  ©JPIMedia Publishing Ltd. ." target"_self" href"#" id"cookieSettings" class"sc-dqBHgY sc-gxMtzJ bAegnq"Cookie SettingsTerms and ConditionsPrivacy policyModern Slavery Statement  News you can trust since News" class"expand" role"button" tabindex""  " "  "  scale translate " points"  .  . title: major regeneration of silverwood golfski complex in lurgan out for consulation
story: Jake Bailey-Sloan: Lack of witnesses ‘hard to take’ says heartbroken father of popular Portadown murder victim   Portadown member of Glenanne Gang Garfield Beattie jailed for sending threatening letter to daughter of his murder victimNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPeopleMajor regeneration of Silverwood Golf Ski Complex in Lurgan out for consulationA major regeneration of Silverwood Golf Ski Complex is out for consultation, says Armagh, Banbridge and Craigavon Council.By Carmel RobinsonMonday, nd November , : pm  "       "  The project aims to look at ‘opportunities’ which will maintain the golf and ski complex and also new proposals which ‘will benefit and improve the health and wellbeing of the local community’.The Council says ‘all options’ will considered including ABC Council’s ‘ambitions to create a high quality visitor and leisure destination’.A spokesperson said: “Armagh City, Banbridge and Craigavon Borough Council has commenced a major regeneration project for Silverwood Golf and Leisure Complex, in Lurgan, as part of an initial consultation in relation to leisure and recreational investment in the area.Aerial shot of Silverwood Golf Club on the outskirts of Lurgan, Co Armagh.“The project aims to explore opportunities that will ensure access to high quality and publicly accessible recreational facilities at the site are maintained, and that any new proposals will benefit and improve the health and wellbeing of the local community.As part of this project an initial Expression Of Interestprocess has commenced, and provides an exciting opportunity for Silverwood, one that the Council hopes will attract inward investment and potential new developments for the area. All options will be considered by the Council with a view to providing sustainable Leisure and Recreational services and facilities to benefit the local community, staff and wider region into the future.Speaking about the potential regeneration plans the Lord Major of Armagh City, Banbridge and Craigavon Borough Council said: “The Silverwood area is well known for its outdoor leisure uses, with a long history of golfing, a ski centre and ancillary uses that the Council wishes to protect, support and sustain into the future. “Enabling this to happen will require the Council to undertake a major regeneration project at Silver Wood Golf and Leisure Complex, as part of a consultation in relation to leisure and recreational investment in the area. “In addition to the current service and facilities provision, there is the potential, subject to sensitive reconfiguring of the site, to incorporate new uses that complement those currently in place, and contribute to the Councils ambitions to create a high quality visitor and leisure destination based on the site and its surrounding assets”.EOI’s are sought for the potential use development of the site, to assist with the Council’s consideration of the options available and preparation of a forthcoming procurement exercise. If you would like further information or to discuss the EOI please contact Council at [email#protected] or the agent Lambert Smith Hampton on   . Jake Bailey-Sloan: Lack of witnesses ‘hard to take’ says heartbroken father of popular Portadown murder victimEditor’s Message:Thank you for reading this article.
